data.text: How can governments support people and firms during #COVID19? We explore these issues in our special notes series. Download 💾 the latest here: https://t.co/OKASSzpHeb https://t.co/Sg1SciSnht

-New IMF staff research shows a strong link between open trade and a decrease in the power of domestic firms, which could translate to lower costs for households and businesses particularly in emerging and developing economies. #ChartOfTheWeek #IMFBlog https://t.co/3gmbXcoRN1

On the latest @EQUALSHope podcast, @KGeorgieva talks to Oxfam’s @maxlawsontin and @nadiadaar about inequality, taxation, climate change and how we can work toward a fairer and greener world. Listen here ➡️ https://t.co/3rwk5b7neh https://t.co/xdK0jG2XF0

Investing in a more resilient future for sub-Saharan #Africa is more cost-effective than repeated rebuilding after crises or disasters. That should be a guiding policy for emerging from the #COVID19 pandemic. #IMFBlog https://t.co/B858uOldac
Helping #Bangladesh Recover from #COVID19 https://t.co/oUuZ0y27kC https://t.co/3TgeZSfdeC
Guilt, #Gender, and an Inclusive Recovery: A Lesson from Japan - more in #IMFBlog https://t.co/2Sj3DL65ih #COVID19 https://t.co/an0vC95mWb

In less than four months, billions of dollars have been disbursed to over one-third of our member countries. This 90 second milestone video, reveals how we are meeting the #COVID19 challenge, and how much we have to give. https://t.co/ahowlEjAOF https://t.co/MaqrAn6fzc

📢 How to participate in the #IMFmeetings Fellowship contest

☑️ Be between 20 and 32 years
☑️ Complete application 
☑️ Share your views on how to create more opportunities for young people 

☑️ Accepting entries from all 189 member-countries

To help members cope with this once-in-a-century pandemic, IMF lending programs are adapting—through innovation and increased flexibility. #IMFBlog https://t.co/CXERyN6hfL #COVID19 https://t.co/ST3u6rS22o

Infrastructure projects like roads and bridges tend to be large, long-term, and complex—all fertile ground for #corruption 💸 💰.  Read about how countries can cut the waste ➡️ https://t.co/ii8MdTINxO #IMFBlog https://t.co/B23LxoRA7u
As much as half of the world’s work is unpaid—most of it done by women—with large differences across countries. https://t.co/1x5faBlNuq #IMFGender #EqualPay #IMFBlog https://t.co/WCEmDeUapt

Sub-Saharan Africa’s digital transformation will be key for boosting jobs, broadening financial inclusion and enhancing government revenues. But more needs to be done to improve internet usage and affordability. #IMFBlog  #IMFAfrica #COVID19 https://t.co/B858uOCOyM https://t.co/PMdgjCRDOn

What recovery efforts should be considered to create more jobs and opportunities for young people? Be heard. Submit your ideas here: https://t.co/vgUj5ocKuX for a chance to become an IMF Fellow. #IMFMeetings https://t.co/zgzjBsndxI

Like many emerging market countries, #Bangladesh has suffered a triple blow during the pandemic: a domestic slowdown, a sharp decline in exports, and a drop in remittances. Find out how the IMF is helping this country during the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/wERo2EBdws https://t.co/0LxZ3NKT1p

.@KGeorgieva: Let’s use this opportunity to build capacity to withstand future shocks and remember the words of Nelson Mandela “do not judge me by my successes, judge me by how many times I fell down and got back up again.” https://t.co/6MLp3MC0tD #AfricaGCA https://t.co/83O7aV5Wqz

Expanding the number of whales may be one of the most impactful ways we can fight #ClimateChange. At the @PaulsonInst, @Kgeorgieva highlighted that restoring the global 🐳  population would remove as much carbon from the air as planting 2 bln🌳. #NatureNow
https://t.co/30XnA048Ta https://t.co/n3v9tKurjd

During the current economic downturn triggered by the #pandemic, the IMF has provided financial assistance, mainly through emergency lending and precautionary lending tools, to about 80 countries. More in the latest #IMFBlog https://t.co/CXERyNnSEl #COVID19 https://t.co/RXpDmjrZRd

The IMF Executive Board today approved the disbursement of US$1 billion to #Angola and an augmentation of US$765 million under the current Extended Fund Facility arrangement to address the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/6MLp3MkpC5 #IMFAfrica https://t.co/hElhEYYCJH

Investing in a more resilient future for sub-Saharan #Africa is more cost-effective than repeated rebuilding after crises or disasters. That should be a guiding policy for emerging from the #COVID19 pandemic. #IMFBlog https://t.co/B858uOCOyM https://t.co/gHzyVwl48Y

The EU has made important progress to reduce emissions, with total emissions currently at nearly 1/4 below their 1990 level. But achieving a climate-neutral economy by 2050 will require much stronger policy action. Two new studies discuss what is needed: https://t.co/mq51aBiYRa https://t.co/vmNcPKtCyN
Find @KGeorgieva's opening remarks at the @FriendsofEurope #FoEDebate here: https://t.co/Mo39eRxMGX https://t.co/mpoQm0BpP5

STARTING NOW: Join @KGeorgieva and @FriendsofEurope for a lively discussion on how Europe can further support low-carbon and climate-resilient growth at the time of #COVID19.  #FoEDebate https://t.co/Jf8sbNY2BW https://t.co/Igzub0APTV

.@KGeorgieva: Let’s use this opportunity to build capacity to withstand future shocks and remember the words of Nelson Mandela “do not judge me by my successes, judge me by how many times I fell down and got back up again.” #AfricaGCA https://t.co/QWis26flsg

.@KGeorgieva: The IMF recommends three areas of focus for building a greener and more resilient future in sub-Saharan Africa: enhance key infrastructure, invest in people, and strengthen safety nets to help manage shocks. https://t.co/B858uOCOyM #AfricaGCA https://t.co/KDhGEBIN52
LIVE: @KGeorgieva joins @AfDB_Group and @GCAdaptation for the launch of the Global Center on Adaptation Africa. Watch here ➡️ https://t.co/ivBzgLzgIS #AfricaGCA #AdaptOurWorld https://t.co/aA6rdE4wJl

What recovery efforts should be considered to create more jobs and opportunities for young people? Be heard. Submit your ideas here: https://t.co/q3NE71zWEb for a chance to become an IMF Fellow. #IMFmeetings #IMFYouth https://t.co/ldWWh0wfpo

Managing Director @KGeorgieva will join @GCAdaptation and @AfDB_Group tomorrow, Sep 16 at 8:00 a.m. ET for the launch of the Global Center on Adaptation Africa. Watch LIVE. https://t.co/Ri1siMpltV #AfricaGCA https://t.co/pobYu20q77

#SubSaharanAfrica is highly impacted by climate shocks. That’s why policies to empower people, strengthen infrastructure and improve coping mechanisms must be central to building forward better from the #COVID19 crisis. #IMFBlog https://t.co/B858uOCOyM https://t.co/2GnvrrrkjD

Income inequality leads to pervasive inequities in access to education, healthcare, and finance. It also hampers the quality and quantity of economic growth. https://t.co/xisXkJg7fA https://t.co/iis309gDNZ

Trade can be a tool for efficient recovery. A study of years’ worth of firm-level data shows trade is a potent tool for limiting how much companies can charge consumers above their costs in #subSaharanAfrica and beyond. #ChartOfTheWeek #IMFBlog https://t.co/3gmbXcoRN1 https://t.co/TuDQlzbuWM

Many part of the world runs heavily on #remittances—the money which overseas workers send back home. But with the pandemic, millions of migrant workers have lost their jobs, threatening this source of funding. What can policy makers do? #COVID19 #IMFBlog https://t.co/8gNqMz34Bj

Trade barriers aren’t the answer to address persistent global imbalances, according to latest IMF External Sector Report. Instead, cooperation is needed for durable global rebalancing &to resolve trade tensions that endanger the recovery #IMFBlog #COVID19 https://t.co/PikqC83GGI https://t.co/OVKIvDx6xx

Women who lose jobs due to #COVID19 often have no safety net, because they are more likely to work in the informal sector, with no labor-law protections and no pension and health benefits. https://t.co/sDllkbym35 #IMFBlog https://t.co/TINfS5fREL
